title: Pass the AUX
summary: Pass the AUX is a social music controller for iOS where multiple people can play music to a shared "room".
tech_stack: JavaScript, NodeJS, MongoDB, Spotify Web API, ExpressJS, socket.io, Heroku, ESLint, Apple Push Notification System
responsibilities: I served as the sole backend developer for this project and worked to create a NodeJS server that allowed users to play music to a shared "room". The server also communicated with Spotify's Player API to synchronize playback between users' devices. Original implementation used socket.io, which was later scrapped.
description: A social music controller for iOS
highlights: Express server with REST API, MongoDB database built on top of a NodeJS backend
Experimented implementation with socket.io for real time updates to queue
Push notifications with Apple and Firebase
Built on top of Spotify API

title: neildevas.com
summary: neildevas.com is a website I built for myself to showcase past experiences and work history.
tech_stack: React, GatsbyJS, GraphQL, Netlify, Adobe XD, Adobe Photoshop
responsibilities: Learned UI/UX design and Adobe Photoshop from an online class and created this website. Built with GatsbyJS.
description: This beautiful site you are looking at right now
highlights: Learned UI/UX design with Adobe XD, designed website from scratch
